name: Simulator Upgrade Project
description: Developed a C# overlay and Arduino-based hardware system that enhanced in-game immersion through real-time telemetry integration. The system featured an in-game overlay displaying live vehicle data, an ABS sensor, a PWM-controlled fan that adjusted speed based on vehicle velocity, and a distance sensor used to dynamically calibrate the optimal field of view (FOV) based on the player's position.
summary: Integrated C# overlay and Arduino hardware for immersive driving simulation.

resources.description: Houses the Arduino controller and handles all serial communcation with the PC.
Used for detecting the distance the player is from the screen to calculate the optimal field of view.
Dynamically adjusted fan speed based on speed on the car.
Rumble motors that trigger based on the status of the cars ABS module.

name: Smart Weather Clock
description: Collaborated with another student to design and develop a smart clock featuring time display, weather updates, and alarm functionality. The system utilized two ESP32 microcontrollers connected via serial communication, configured as main and daughter boards to optimize memory usage and overcome RAM limitations inherent to the ESP32 platform. The device included a captive portal for simplified Wi-Fi configuration and supported integration with a web application through MQTT for remote interaction and monitoring.

name: AssettoNet
description: A lightweight C# interface for receiving and handling real-time telemetry from Assetto Corsa's UDP broadcast for external display or analysis tools.
summary: C# interface for Assetto Corsa real-time telemetry.

name: Wendy Art Cataloging Tool
description: A VB.NET forms application for recording and cataloging an extensive art collection, to enable easy interface for online archives and stores.
